title: Tree-Thinning Projects To Prevent California Wildfires May Be Approved Faster
text:
Coronavirus Closures: Golf Courses Among Sites To Close Due To Yuba County Health Order, Sacramento Courses Still OpenYuba County said it’s new restrictions and clarifications of what is and isn’t essential are all about proactively flattening the curve.

Placerville Vice Mayor Shares Story After Testing Positive For CoronavirusPlacerville Vice Mayor Dennis Thomas is recovering after testing positive for coronavirus.

Coronavirus Unemployment: What if You’re Furloughed Or Your Hours Are Reduced?If you are furloughed without pay, you’re entitled to full unemployment, just like anyone else out of work. And if you’re furloughed with partial pay, you may qualify for partial benefits.

Job-Matching Website Launches Amid Coronavirus In CaliforniaThe governor says the jobs are out there, but since the website, Onward California, launched, only 8% of that unemployed population has logged in to check it out.
meta_description: California regulators have streamlined the state's permit process to make it faster to approve tree-thinning projects intended to slow wildfires.
